Using CDN for React develpment

React web apps can be developed just by adding react and react-dom CDN's in the head section of HTML.

  • Use the development CDN links only while developing. Use the Production CDN links(minified and optimised) while moving to production.
  • Change the verion numbers of the CDN's as required.
#

React Example with CDN

In the above example to create web elements React.createElement() is used. This is the dafault way of creating web elements in React. Here is the prototype of React.createElement() .

But creating web elements using HTML is more comfortable than using React.createElement() . So there is an alternate way to create web elements using JSX. To use JSX we should use bable dependancy. Bable can transpile new javascript features(ES6) to older versions of javascript. So we can develop web apps using the new javascript features (Which old browsers cannot support) and babel helps in maintaining all browsers compatability. Here babel transpiles JSX to React.createElement() .


Here is the Babel CDN, add this to the head section of HTML.

#

React Example with CDN and JSX

I this example 17 to 19 lines is JSX code. It will be transpiled to React.createElement() by Babel. Syntactically it looks like writing HTML in middle of javascript.


If the above code is opened in the browser it throws the fallowing warning in the console

You are using the in-browser Babel transformer. Be sure to precompile your scripts for production

It is telling that you shouldn't run Babel in the browser on production sites, because running Babel in the browser is slower than precompiling your files with Babel, because the browser will have to compile your files every time you open a page. So it is good to precompile you files with Babel with can be done with the help of webpack. To learn this refer React With Webpack
